document.docAuthor: M, E L E N A V., Va, I K H A L J O & Lim, Kil-Young
document.masterDocTitle: The millipede genus Epanerchodus Attems, 1901 in the Korean Peninsula, with a description of a new species (Diplopoda, Polydesmida, Polydesmidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. This species was originally described from Yuki, North Korea (
Verhoeff, 1937
). It is a senior subjective synonym of
Epanerchodus dichotomus
Takakuwa, 1954
and
Epanerchodus bifidus
Takakuwa, 1954
; their synonymy was revealed by
Mikhaljova & Lim ( 2001 )
.
E. dichotomus
was described from the very same locality Yuki, North Korea (
Takakuwa, 1954
),
E. bifidus
was described from Mt. Aso, Kyushu, Japan and Pujeon- Koweon and Masan, Korea (
Takakuwa, 1954
). This species is quite common in the Korean Peninsula. In Primorskiy kray, Far East of Russia , it is relatively rare. The species lives in forest litter and has been recorded in caves (
Murakami & Paik, 1968
;
Mikhaljova, 1997
).
Distribution. Russia : Far East (southern part of Primorskiy kray), North and South Korea , southern Japan .
